abstract: Former orphanage in Boys Town, Neb, which is now a national juvenile rehabilitation center, is changing its middle and high school curriculum back to vocational classes, or career-readiness courses, in effort to produce workers skilled in trades like construction and automotive repair; $1.5 million renovation will outfit its high school with welding stations, engine repair shop, greenhouse and culinary arts kitchens.
lead_paragraph: In an overhaul, the Nebraska village, which began as an orphanage in 1917, is refocusing on its original vision of producing skilled workers.
snippet: In an overhaul, the Nebraska village, which began as an orphanage in 1917, is refocusing on its original vision of producing skilled workers.

headline.main: Boys Town’s Rehab Vision Remains, Now Sharpening Minds and Skills
headline.print_headline: Boys Town’s Rehab Vision Remains, Now Sharpening Minds and Skills
